# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    for word in split(text, r"\s+")
        if length(word) > text_width
            # Handle edge case where the first word is too long
            push!(lines, "$word")
        else
            # Check if current line + word would exceed text_width
            current_line_length = sum([length(w) for w in lines])
            while true
                if length(word) + current_line_length <= text_width
                    push!(lines, "")
                    break
                end
                # Trim the last word of the line if it's longer than a space
                if length(pop!(lines)) == 0
                    throw(ErrorException("Failed to wrap text"))
                end
            end
        end
        # Append word to current line
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Hello world! This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
# wrapped_text == "Hello world!\nThis is a very long sentence\nthat needs to be wrapped."
```
